item.title: Mom add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Mom add a quote by Jan Karon
item.description: "I'd like you to know that I have forgiven him. Again and again. Once done, course, back comes the Enemy to persecute and persecute, and I must ante up to God and forgive yet again." -- Jan Karon

item.title: Mom add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "...the thought crossed her mind that a bed was really a very strange thing-a human nest, really, where our human fragility made its nightly demands for comfort and cosseting" -- Alexander McCall Smith

item.title: Mom add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "The trouble with Grace, she thought, is that she is so literal. But that was the trouble with most people, when it came down to it; there were very few who enjoyed flights of fantasy, and to have that sort of mind--one which enjoyed dry with and understood the absurd--left one in a shrinking minority." -- Alexander McCall Smith

item.title: Mom add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "And then the second thing you have to do is go and see your son. That is a duty of love, Andrew. It's as simple as that. A duty of love. Do you understand what I'm saying to you?" -- Alexander McCall Smith

item.title: Mom add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Nothing gives a sadder sense of decay than this loss or suspension of the power to deal with unaccustomed things, and to keep up with the swiftness of the passing moment. [Speaking of self-posed isolation in old age.]" -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Mom add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorn
item.description: "This was a freedom essential to the health even of a character so little susceptible of morbid influences as that of Phoebe. The old house [with dry rot in its structure and perhaps also in its inhabitants];...it was not good to breathe no other atmosphere that that." -- Nathaniel Hawthorn
